definition: to fly about/to fly hither and thither/to flit/to swarm/to spiral
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: So useful to have him swooping around like an overgrown bat.
sentences.chinese: 他飞来飞去象个大蝙蝠倒是真有用。

sentences.english: The butterflies flirted from flower to flower.
sentences.chinese: 蝴蝶在花丛中飞来飞去。

sentences.english: Bees swarmed about in the orchard.
sentences.chinese: 蜜蜂成群地在果园里飞来飞去。

sentences.english: Little sparrows fluttered among the branches.
sentences.chinese: 小麻雀在枝条间飞来飞去。

sentences.english: Bees are humming [buzzing] around from flower to flower.
sentences.chinese: 蜜蜂在花丛中嗡嗡地飞来飞去。

sentences.english: It wears a golden mask, flits about in the forest.
sentences.chinese: 它戴着金色的假面，在森林里飞来飞去。

sentences.english: Now, Zoe, stop fluttering around, and I will tell you a story.
sentences.chinese: 现在，佐伊，停止飞来飞去的，我将告诉你一个故事。

sentences.english: these are all so many shadows, flitting about, out of touch with the world.
sentences.chinese: 这些都是众多飞来飞去的阴影，与这个世界没有关联。

sentences.english: The bird fluttered about, trying to get out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 鸟儿拍打着翅膀飞来飞去，想要飞出屋去。

sentences.english: They usually wear pointed hatsand fly around on broomsticks.
sentences.chinese: 他们通常戴着尖顶的帽子，骑在扫把上飞来飞去。

sentences.english: A bee is poising over the flowers.
Then we flew around our house in a rainbow of laughter.
sentences.chinese: 最后我们在屋子里飞来飞去，划出一道道笑声的彩虹。

sentences.english: They usually wear pointed hats and fly around on broomsticks.
sentences.chinese: 他们通常戴着尖顶的帽子，骑在扫把上飞来飞去。

sentences.english: The birds fluttered excitedly in the trees.
sentences.chinese: 鸟儿在树林中兴奋地飞来飞去。

sentences.english: As we stepped into the bush, birds flitted from tree to tree.
sentences.chinese: 我们走进灌木丛，鸟儿在树间飞来飞去。

sentences.english: Hundreds of blue birds flew around her tower every day.
sentences.chinese: 每天，几百只蓝色的小鸟围绕着塔飞来飞去。

definition: to flutter/to dance in the breeze
to circle in the air/to soar
to travel back and forth/to shuttle
to spiral/to circle/to go around/to hover/to orbit
making up a group, forming a troupe (idiom); in large numbers/as a large crowd
